Package eu.etaxonomy.cdm.model.name

Provides classes for nomenclature and typification.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ITypeDesignation  
 

Class Summary
BacterialName The taxon name class for bacteria.
BotanicalName The taxon name class for plants and fungi.
CultivarPlantName The taxon name class for cultivars (cultivated plants).
HomotypicalGroup The homotypical group class represents a set of taxon names associated on the base of their typifications.
HybridRelationship The class representing a hybrid relationship between one of the parents of a hybrid taxon name and the hybrid taxon name itself.
HybridRelationshipType The class representing the categories of hybrid relationships between a botanical taxon name used as a parent of a hybrid taxon name and the hybrid taxon name itself.
NameRelationship The class representing a relationship between two taxon names according to the nomenclatural code which governs both of them.
NameRelationshipType The class representing the categories of taxon name relationships between two taxon names.
NameTypeDesignation The class representing a typification of a taxon name with a rank above "species aggregate" by another taxon name.
NomenclaturalCode The class for the five nomenclature codes (ICNB, ICBN, ICNCP, ICZN and ICVCN) ruling taxon names.
NomenclaturalStatus The class representing the assignation of a nomenclatural status to a taxon name.
NomenclaturalStatusType The class representing categories of nomenclatural status (like "invalid", "conserved" or "novum") to qualify the use of a particular taxon name string depending on its nomenclatural reference (original publication), on its nomenclatural code and on possible decisions of the corresponding competent authorities.
NonViralName<T extends NonViralName> The taxon name class for all non viral taxa.
Rank The class representing the taxonomical ranks (like "Family", "Genus" or "Species") used for taxon names across all nomenclatural codes for bacteria (ICNB), viruses (ICVCN), plants and fungi (ICBN), cultivars (ICNCP) and animals (ICZN).
SpecimenTypeDesignation The class representing a typification of one or several taxon names by a specimen or a figure.
TaxonNameBase<T extends TaxonNameBase,S extends INameCacheStrategy> The upmost (abstract) class for scientific taxon names regardless of any particular nomenclature code.
TypeDesignationBase The (abstract) class representing a typification of one or several taxon names.
TypeDesignationStatus The class representing status (categories) of specimen type designations for a taxon name or a set of them.
ViralName The taxon name class for viral taxa.
ZoologicalName The taxon name class for animals.
 

Package eu.etaxonomy.cdm.model.name Description

Provides classes for nomenclature and typification.
